name: Disney's Boardwalk Inn

reviews.text: This was a splurge for us to celebrate a birthday. I did the online check-in as advised to lessen the wait and I was told we could pick up paper tickets at the customer service desk in the hotel. I had gotten tickets through AAA and purchased tickets for Mickey's Christmas Party via phone; however the official paper Disney tickets had to be obtained.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: When we arrived at Boardwalk Inn there was no on-line check in line so we had to wait in a regular line. I showed someone my ticket vouchers and was told they could not provide the tickets because of some type of computer upgrade.
reviews.title: Mediocre Hotel, Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in around 10:30 AM and were told they would advise us when the room was clean . We asked to store our luggage in the meantime.
reviews.title: Boardwalk Inn more and more a Mickey Mouse Operation

reviews.text: The people at the check in counters were mostly tired looking and grouchy. The hotel never advised us our room was ready. Another family member arrived that evening and checked in later and that is how we knew the room location and that it was clean.
reviews.title: A Great Experience
I would agree....
reviews.text: When we went to retrieve our luggage there were about 5 or 6 people milling around with nothing to do and we were the only people in line, but it took about 7 minutes to retrieve 4 small bags.

This was our first stay at the Boardwalk. We stayed at Port Orleans for 2 nights in order to take advantage of boat transportation to Downtown Disney, and then transferred to Boardwalk to be near Epcot. (Also saved $ by splitting time between mid- and deluxe-priced resorts). Had no issues with our luggage being moved from one resort to the other - very efficiently handled while we were at the parks.
reviews.title: First stay, and will be back

reviews.text: Boardwalk is a large resort, with conference center. My kids were disappointed by no free WiFi, but liked the room layout and location. Our room on the 3rd floor overlooked the front entrance and Magical Express pickup location, but I'm actually glad we didn't pay more to overlook the boardwalk and water, because I think those rooms would pick up a lot of the noise below. Walking back from Epcot one night at 11 pm, there were groups of teenagers throwing a football on the lawn area between the hotel and boardwalk itself, and I'd imagine the sound just amplified, up to the higher floors.
reviews.title: Brief but excellent one night stay

reviews.text: Pastries/breakfast beverages were sold in the small lounge area on the 2nd floor, and I think the pastries were from the Boardwalk Bakery. In the morning, long lines formed outside the Bakery on the boardwalk outside, but there was a little cart/vendor right across from the Bakery selling the same items, with no line! We saved a lot of time by buying them at the cart, and eating while walking to Epcot.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay, Great Location

reviews.text: Main draw to this resort for us was the walkability to Epcot. The entrance to Epcot is between the France and England pavilions, and it's great to not have to deal with the long lines at the main entrance to the park. Takes about 5-10 minutes, depending how fast you walk. My only gripe is with the "bag inspection" - is anything actually found in a bag that is ever an issue? It really holds up the line when you get behind a family who brings 3 large stuffed backpacks with 18 different compartments in each pack! (What the heck do they pack in those, anyway?)
reviews.title: Boardwalks just average

reviews.text: The pool's waterslide was closed for repairs when we were there, and the first day the pool was closed when spraypaint got in the water. Disappointing, but what can you do? Pool was open the next day, and seemed very clean. Bar near the pool serves drinks and snacks.
reviews.title: Business Traveler's Nightmare

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had stayed at the Boardwalk Inn in 1997 with family and liked it a lot. I especially liked the location and as we were a couple of "oldies" our aim was to avoid noisy kiddie crowds and this hotel seemed the best choice. It is closest to the parks we wanted to visit. We had no wait at all checking in about 1PM on a Monday afternoon and were upgaded to a villa/cottage. I'm really not sure what they called it but it was nice and quiet and right by the pool and way more room than we needed. Since we were out all day we made little use of the lower level. But the fridge was handy.
reviews.title: Very nice but not perfection
Very Nice
reviews.text: Our biggest complaint was the price of getting a breakfast reasonably. My husband really like a good fiber cereal and it cost us one snack point or over $3 for a dinky box of Raisin Bran and milk.
I still love the this hotel but really think free wi-fi for in rooms is not too much to ask. I opted for 1 24 period during our 3 night stay.
reviews.title: Concierge level room was worth it

reviews.text: The Boardwalk's location is prime! Loved the spacious rooms ... even with a family of five. Check in was a breeze. Unfortunately the pool slide was being refurbished so we couldn't enjoy that feature. I thought the pool bar should have closed a bit later. I would have liked a bit more of a resort feel at the pool but since the slide was broken maybe I missed that.
reviews.title: Hotel is in a great location and overall nice.

reviews.text: We walked to Epcot every night. One trip to the Hess station (go straight out the front door of the hotel) provided beverages and snacks for the room for the entire week at a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Is Disney getting old?

reviews.text: This was our 4th stay at the Boardwalk, and have been very pleased in the past (the location is stellar). We choose this hotel again because we were at WDW for Marathon Weekend, and the proximity to the race start was a plus. Like others reviewers, we completed the on-line check-in, only to find that there is no expedited, separate station at the Boardwalk. As a result, I waited in the same long line as everyone else. I did receive a view upgrade (without asking), which was wonderful until I see the rusted windows and obvious leaking and wallpaper destruction underneath. (This did take away from the view of the courtyard just a bit...) HOWEVER, the most disappointing and unacceptable part of this stay was the fact that THERE WAS NO HOT WATER IN OUR ROOM. Imagine running at 5:30 am, at 45 temperatures, coming back for a nice hot shower, and finding less than lukewarm water. I initially received no response from management, and called back after waiting for 3 hours for maintenance- time not spent at the parks. After 6 additional calls, someone did come up, and the engineer did admit to me that "one of their boilers was down". It wasn't until the following morning that we had hot, hot water, and not a single manager called back to check if our problem was resolved. Upon check-out, I mentioned our difficulties very politely to the staff, and got nothing more than a casual "sorry". The water wasn't, but I am boiling.....
reviews.title: Sooo disappointed

reviews.text: It was my wife,mother-in-law and I. This was my mother-in-laws first time and she loved it.We had put her into a wheelchair to help her get around and the hotel had it right there for us to rent for the entire stay.The bus driver's were disappointing because they asked if she would get out of the chair and when we said yes,there was no help with the wheel chair,just for us to do it ourselves.Loved the room and the help from the concierge section but the lobby help and manager's made you feel like we we're bothering them.We stayed in 2009 not 2010.
reviews.title: pleasant

reviews.text: Arrived at Orlando on December 11. We purchased a Disney Package and were told since we had checked in online, we would expedite receiving our tour package and room keys. On the bus, the video confirmed that there is a special desk at the resorts for online checked guests.
reviews.title: Wow -- I expected better than this...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nope, not at the Boardwalk. The desk clerk advised me that the printers weren’t working and he would have to complete our information manually. He was moderately pleasant. I asked a few questions about the return trip and referred me to the Concierge, who referred me to the Bell Captains desk, who gave me inaccurate information (we had an early flight home on December 16 and wanted to be sure we did things right.)
reviews.title: More than I expected.

reviews.text: Our room was a bit worn but serviceable. Some toast remnants on the kitchenette counter and the back splash needed a little cleaning, but OK. The room is pretty much standard Marriott Courtyard, except for the price.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

description: Disney's BoardWalk Inn is a Disney Deluxe Resort that captures the charm, whimsy and elegance of 1940s Atlantic City. Sitting along a boardwalk packed with amusements, the Resort offers dynamic views of activity below and of the glittering waters of Crescent Lake.
